body:
<!-- Thanks for filing an issue! Before hitting the button, please answer these questions.-->

**Is this a request for help?** (If yes, you should use our troubleshooting guide and community support channels, see http://kubernetes.io/docs/troubleshooting/.): No, indicating an issue that I can post a fix for...


**What keywords did you search in Kubernetes issues before filing this one?** (If you have found any duplicates, you should instead reply there.): shasum

---

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?** (choose one): BUG REPORT

<!--
If this is a BUG REPORT, please:
  - Fill in as much of the template below as you can.  If you leave out
    information, we can't help you as well.

If this is a FEATURE REQUEST, please:
  - Describe *in detail* the feature/behavior/change you'd like to see.

In both cases, be ready for followup questions, and please respond in a timely
manner.  If we can't reproduce a bug or think a feature already exists, we
might close your issue.  If we're wrong, PLEASE feel free to reopen it and
explain why.
-->

**Kubernetes version** (use `kubectl version`): latest on master


**Environment**:
- **Cloud provider or hardware configuration**:
- **OS** (e.g. from /etc/os-release): CentOS 7
- **Kernel** (e.g. `uname -a`):
Linux localhost.localdomain 3.10.0-514.10.2.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Fri Mar 3 00:04:05 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

- **Install tools**:
- **Others**:


**What happened**:
When trying to run unit tests with coverage, it fails in hack/make-rules/test.sh as there is no shasum command on the OS, instead it has sha1um command.


hack/make-rules/test.sh: line 242: shasum: command not found
!!! [0505 16:38:55] Call tree:
!!! [0505 16:38:55]  1: hack/make-rules/test.sh:347 runTests(...)
make: *** [test] Error 1


**What you expected to happen**:
Work :)


**How to reproduce it** (as minimally and precisely as possible):
KUBE_COVER=y make test


**Anything else we need to know**:
I'll push up a PR to resolve this.
title: Coverage fails on CentOS as no shasum command
